frame.name: Have_associated
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Topical_entity</fen> has properties which are affected by the existence and association of an <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Time">By the 1920s</fex> <fex name="Topical_entity">a characteristic book</fex> <t>had</t> <fex name="Entity">black and white photographic illustrations only</fex> .</ex>
<ex><fex name="Topical_entity">Their schools</fex> <t>had</t> <fex name="Ent">an improved and more balanced curriculum</fex> .</ex>
<ex><fex name="Circumstances">With dual citizenship</fex> , <fex name="Topical_entity">Stephen</fex> <fex name="Time">now</fex> <t>had</t> <fex name="Entity">two presidents he hated</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition: <def-root>Some entity, abstract or concrete, which is stated to exist and be associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists and is associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The period during which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists in association with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root>A situation, force, or entity which brings about the existence of the <fen>Entity</fen> or its association with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The place where the <fen>Entity</fen> is associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Circumstances</fen> marks expressions that indicate a set of conditions under which the <fen>Entity</fen> is declared to exist in association with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Point_of_view
FE.definition:
<def-root>The perspective of an individual who judges whether they consider the <fen>Entity</fen> to be associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.
<ex><fex name="pov">In the United States' eyes</fex>, the country doesn't <t>have</t> any real infrastructure.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Concessive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. </def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. </def-root>

FE.name: Topical_entity
FE.definition: <def-root>The entity under discussion, whose states and properties are impacted by its association with the <fen>Entity</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>
